title: Diamond as Big as the Ritz - organization

content.prompt: Which choice best describes the overall organization of the passage?

choices.label: The narrator provides context about a character’s environment before detailing a turning point in that character’s life.
The narrator summarizes a character’s past and then speculates on future events that will befall that character.
The narrator presents a conflict within a family before explaining the circumstances that led up to that conflict.
The narrator describes the thought process underlying a family’s decision and then conveys their regrets about that decision.

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Identify and describe how plot orders events in a narrative.
